abstract.t: This document defines the BGP Cease NOTIFICATION message "Shutdown Message" subcode for operators to transmit a short freeform message to describe why a BGP session was shutdown.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in .

section.title: Introduction
section.t: It has been discovered that certain BGP Path Attribute values have been used in BGP implementations which have been deployed in the wild while not being assigned by the IANA for such usage. This has led to deployment problems for new technologies such as Large BGP Communities.
The squatting of values 30, 31, 129, 241, 242 and 243 has been confirmed by the involved vendors or through source code review.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: Per this document, IANA is requested to assign a subcode called "Shutdown Message" in the "BGP Cease NOTIFICATION message subcodes" registry under the "Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Parameters" group.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This document uses UTF-8 encoding for the Shutdown Message. There are a number of security issues with UNICODE. Any implementer and operator is advised to review UNICODE TR36 (UTR36) to learn about these issues. This document guards against the technical issues outlined in UTR36 by REQUIRING "shortest form" encoding. However, the visual spoofing due to character confusion still persists. This document tries to minimize the effects of visual spoofing by allowing UNICODE only where local script is expected and needed.
